intro: Sarcocephalus esculentus, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its tuberous roots are the edible part, valued for their starchy texture and mild flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
